pages.text: The furnace heater is a very efficient heater, but burnable fuel is required. There is no heating setpoint configurable, the heating is dependant on the rate of flow. At 50000 l/h, this is 100Â°C. Lower flowrates will heat up more.$(br2)The furnace heater has a cold (input) and hot (output) side, it is important that fluids respect this flow path.

The block does not need power, but any type of solid fuel such as coal or lava buckets can be used.$(br2)The furnace heater will pass fluids through, meaning it's not necessary to have a pump extract fluids from this block. It's also possible to chain heaters in series.
